intro: Arabidopsis halleri, commonly known as the alpine cress, is a small flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. This species is characterized by its rosette of dark green, hairy leaves and small white or yellow flowers. Arabidopsis halleri is often found in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. It is also notable for its ability to accumulate heavy metals, making it a subject of ecological and environmental research.
